page.title: 08TRANSPORT IN STAMBOURNE
page.content: The Hedingham Omnibus Company runs single decker buses which serve the village as follows (return journeys): to London;Monday,Wednesday,Friday: to Halstead;Tuesday:to Braintree; Wednesday:to Haverhill;Friday. School buses take children to primary and secondary schools, and taxis bring in children from outlying areas to catch these buses in the village. For longer journeys, long-distance coaches can be boarded on the A604 at Gt. Yeldham. The nearest British Rail stations are at Braintree (14 miles) & Audley End (15 miles). It is very difficult to make journeys by public transport, and most people rely on private cars: non-car owners often get lifts with friends and children have to be ferried by their parents. There are no organised car- sharing schemes, only informal ones.
